title: How to Win a Chili Cook Off

steps.headline: Review the rules and regulations of the chili cook-off.
steps.description: You may be disqualified or lose by default if you fail to follow the rules of the cook-off in which you are participating. Learn about any banned ingredients. Some cook-offs ban major ingredients such as rice, pasta and beans. Check the rules for using precooked ingredients in your chili. Precooked ingredients are commonly banned with the exception of beverages, broths or canned tomatoes. Check to see if the cook-off requires you to cook a specific type of chili, such as vegetarian or green chili.

steps.headline: Read and review chili recipes that have won previous cook-off contests.
steps.description: Winning recipes may provide you with ideas, tips or inspiration. Speak to previous cook-off winners about their recipes or contact panel members of the cook-off you are participating in to obtain copies of winning recipes. Visit the website for the International Chili Society to view winning chili recipes. A link to the website is included in the Sources section of this article.

steps.headline: Use marbled meat (such as beef from Angus cattle) that is rich in flavor.
steps.description: Do not use tender cuts of meat such as sirloin, because they may cook away or crumble into the chili. Keep your choice of meat traditional by using beef or pork as opposed to exotic meats like ostrich or snake. Do not use meat that contains gristle or large chunks of fat. Leaner cuts of beef will prevent large quantities of grease from forming in your chili.

steps.headline: Use a blend of numerous spices and peppers.
steps.description: Do not use one specific spice that will dominate the taste of your chili. Unless the chili cook-off is a competition for the spiciest chili, do not allow spicy peppers to overpower the taste of the chili.

steps.headline: Make your chili visually appealing.
Do not excessively stir or boil your chili.
steps.description: The ingredients of your chili will break apart or your chili will develop a runny or mushy consistency.
